Literature Review: Scanning transmission electron microscopy (STEM) has emerged as a pivotal tool in materials science, offering unparalleled resolution and versatility in characterizing materials at the atomic scale. The development of advanced instrumentation, such as highly coherent electron sources, aberration correctors, and direct electron detectors, has significantly enhanced the capabilities of STEM, enabling researchers to explore the structure and properties of materials with unprecedented detail.
